Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= action by which humans speak a language that is unknown and therefore not understood

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= state in which by which humans or objects have become part of the realm of God and his service ► and therefore no longer accessible to humans unless they have gone through special rituals

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= river; ◄ flowing from Mount Hermon (חֶרְמֹון) in a southerly direction through the Sea of Galilee (כִּנֶּרֶת) into the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח)
= action by which humans, supernatural beings, forces of nature, or other objects face a direction different from the one they were facing before

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= action with which humans or animals move in a quick and light or lively way

= male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)
= direct offspring of animals, either male or indeterminate

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= river; ◄ flowing from Mount Hermon (חֶרְמֹון) in a southerly direction through the Sea of Galilee (כִּנֶּרֶת) into the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח)
= action by which humans, supernatural beings, forces of nature, or other objects face a direction different from the one they were facing before

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= action with which humans or animals move in a quick and light or lively way

= male herbivorous mammal with four legs; ◄ |iovis ladicaudata|i*, fat tailed sheep; ► clean animal, used for sacrifice, source of meat, hides, wool, and horns; ≈ associated with strength and leadership
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)
= direct offspring of animals, either male or indeterminate

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer

Node.gloss: to tremble|to be distressed|to be in anguish
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience strong fear and distress, ◄ compared to the state of mind of a woman in labor; ► often accompanied by physical side effects, like writhing, and trembling

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= man, also known as Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) ◄ second son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) ► one of the patriarchs of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) in poetic texts often used as a reference to the entire people of Israel
= causative process by which humans, deities, or forces give (other) humans or objects a different nature, character, or form
= hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security
= small body of stagnant water, usually in swampy area; ≈ seen as a blessing when contrasted with the desert, but as a curse when contrasted with a developed area
= hard stone; ◄ consisting of nearly pure silica; ≈ symbol of a strong will power
= an opening in the earth that gives access to the subterranean water which either comes to the surface or can be drawn from it; ≈ its water is regarded as a source of blessing
